title: Thunderbird ad

title: email sending being blocked
content:
When ever the thunderbird email client is selected or anything is copied into a message, the message is blocked and won't be sent. In addition, subsequent messages generated from thunderbird can't be sent. Restarting the app or the computer doesn't help.

The work around is to save to the draft folder and then go on line to gmail and send it from there. That sends it and fixes everything.

This has been going on for a long time and is a problem on both my win 10 and win 11 computers.
creator: hrsweet3

title: Thunderbird version 128.4.0esr
content:
HELP! This new version installed today, and Thunderbird suddenly stopped running and no longer runs. I get the message: "A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile which are no longer compatible with this older version. Use this profile only with that newer version, or create a new profile for this installation of Thunderbird. Creating a new profile requires setting up your accounts, calendars and add-ons again."

The message seems erroneous because it is running the newest version. Should I step back a version? If so, how do I do that?

Thanks!

title: Unable to put attachments in emails after Ubuntu update.
content:
I recently updated from Ubuntu 22.04 to 24.04 after which I cannot add attachments to my Thunderbird (128.3.3esr) emails. The application has been uninstalled and reinstalled both from the Ubuntu programs list and directly as a flatpack from the Mozilla web page. It still does not allow attachments.

Send Message Error "Sending of the message failed. There was an error attaching (insert whatever file type you like here. In my case a .docx). Please check that you have access to the file."

I absolutely have access to the file. I have tried the Attach link, which doesn't appear to attach the document at all. I have also tried using drag and drop. The drag and drop does appear to add the file but you still get the same error when you try to send or save it as a draft.

Any help is greatly appreciated.
creator: the.joe.pollard

title: After closing Inbox, no obvious way to open it again.  Not in Menu Bar.  (Mac)
content:
After closing the In Box, you'd think there'd be some simple obvious way to open it again. But no. The switch is hidden. Your Help agrees that the switch is nowhere to be found in the Menu Bar (as it obviously ought to be), but that it can be found in the Tool Bar.

The Tool Bar is not found in the Menu Bar either (as it obviously ought to be). Short of relaunching the program, what am I to do?

Did the designer of the interface have an addiction to video games? In video games everything is hidden, as though it were FUN to poke around looking. I have never played a video game. They are not fun. They are a waste of time. All commonly used email tools and windows should be accessible under the Menu Bar. Please fix your program. Meanwhile, please tell me how to open the In Box after closing it. Thank you.

Thunderbird 15.5.1 Mac OS
creator: rjbenish137

creator: ubiracicardoso323

title: Windows 11 pro, no puedo enviar correos desde aplicaciones de escritorio
content:
Hola a todos.

Tengo una máquina con Windows 11 Pro en la que no consigo enviar correos desde aplicaciones de escritorio, por ejemplo desde un ERP. Thunderbird funciona normalmente sin embargo, desde su interface y también desde el menú contextual (al pulsar botón dcho. sobre el archivo).

En el PC anterior con Windows 10 funcionaba sin problemas, y esto me ha ocurrido al renovar el PC.

He realizado las configuraciones siguientes:

- Marcar en TB "Comprobar siempre al iniciar si TB es el cliente de correo por omisión" - Seleccionar TB en programas predeterminados.

Como esto no funcionaba he introducido los siguientes datos en el registro:

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Clients\mail > (Default) value = Mozilla Thunderbird HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Clients\Mail > (Default) Value = Mozilla Thunderbird

Muchas gracias de antemano por cualquier ayuda o recomendación.

Saludos cordiales. ___________________ Hello everyone.

I have a Windows 11 Pro machine where I can't send emails from desktop applications, for example from an ERP. Thunderbird works normally, however, from its interface and also from the context menu (by right-clicking on the file).

On the previous PC with Windows 10 it worked without problems, and this happened to me when I upgraded the PC.

I have made the following settings:

- Check in TB "Always check at startup if TB is the default email client" - Select TB in default programs.

Since this didn't work I entered the following data in the registry:

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Clients\mail > (Default) value = Mozilla Thunderbird HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Clients\Mail > (Default) Value = Mozilla Thunderbird

Thank you very much in advance for any help or recommendations.

Kind regards.
creator: hectorgtrade
